text: The white-flanked antwren (Myrmotherula axillaris) is a passerine bird in the antbird family. It is the only antwren with white flank patches. Vieillot named the species in 1817. Because it has a large range, it does not reach the status of vulnerable. == References == == Other websites == *White-flanked Antwren videos on the Internet Bird Collection *Stamps (for Nicaragua) with RangeMap *White-flanked Antwren photo gallery VIREO *White-flanked Antwren Photo ; Article Category:Tyranni Category:Birds of Central America Category:Birds of South America
title: White-flanked antwren
